diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Autoimmune Hypocalciuric Hypercalcemia due to Autoantibodies Directed at the Calcium-Sensing Receptor
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the presence of autoantibodies that stimulated PTH release and caused PTH-dependent hypercalcemia. There were no identified mutations in the calcium-sensing receptor gene, and patients exhibited biochemical features similar to familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia, but the autoimmune nature distinguished it from genetic forms.
